moves.1... c5: The Sicilian -- Van Geemen prepares for hand-to-hand combat.
moves.2. Nf3: The fight for White's Q4 begins at once.
moves.2... e6: Guarding the QBP and opening a second diagonal for his Q.
moves.5. Nc3: Guarding the KP and developing the second Knight.
moves.5... a6: Preventing a White minor piece access to QN5.
moves.6... Qc7: Aiming down the diagonal at the KRP if White does castle.
moves.7... Be7: Developing the K-side, in preparation for eventual castling.
moves.8... Nxd4: This shot wins a piece. If 9 QxN, 9... B-B4 pins and wins the White Queen. So Wiesenhahn resigns.
